definition: to die tragically/to meet with a violent death

sentences.english: Deborah's horrific death was a rare tragedy.
sentences.chinese: 黛博拉的慘死是個極端的悲劇。

sentences.english: She disappeared and is presumed to have been killed by the Nazis.
sentences.chinese: 她失蹤了，並據推測已經慘死在納粹手中。

sentences.english: Green witnessed the mother's death, also recorded the last of her mother's words.
sentences.chinese: 採青目睹了母親的慘死，也記下了母親最後的話。

sentences.english: In the end, generation of artists, actually died from hunger.
sentences.chinese: 到頭來，一代藝人，竟慘死於飢餓。

sentences.english: But only looked far wolhyang the noose tightened collectivisation in the executioner.
sentences.chinese: 但只能遠遠地看着月香慘死在劊子手收緊的絞索下。

sentences.english: Behold Thomas heart attacks, on the way back home collectivisation under the train.
sentences.chinese: 不料托馬斯心臟病發作，在回家的路上慘死在列車下。

sentences.english: Queen Jezebel meets a prophesied horrible death.
sentences.chinese: 耶洗別王后照先知所預言的慘死。

definition: lit. shocks the eye, astonishes the heart (idiom); shocking/horrible to see/a ghastly sight
to fall off or jump off a building
to see with one's own eyes/to witness
unfettered and beyond the law (idiom); evading retribution/getting away with it (e.g. crimes)/still at large
to run away/to flee in disarray
to wound with a blade or hatchet/to slash/to gash
to shoot with a gun/shooting incident
to inflict heavy losses/to inflict serious damage
